article.headline: Holy Cross 60, Colgate 49
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- John Hurley had 16 points and Holy Cross held Colgate without a field goal for nearly nine minutes late in the second half as the Crusaders pulled away for a 60-49 win over the Raiders on Wednesday night. Colgate (11-11, 3-6 Patriot) pulled within 50-44 when Kendall Chones scored an inside basket with 9:03 to play. But the Raiders, playing without top scorer Howard Blue who missed his sixth straight game with a knee injury, did not score another field goal until there were 11 seconds left. Holy Cross (10-12, 4-5) turned up the defensive pressure in the second half, forcing Colgate into 13 turnovers and 32 percent shooting. Kevin Hamilton had 15 points for Holy Cross, while Colgate was led by Chones with 19 points and Mark Linebaugh with 13. The game was tied 28-28 at halftime, but Holy Cross pulled away early in the second half, helped by some key baskets from Torey Thomas and Keith Simmons off the bench. Colgate took an early 14-7 lead, but Jave Meade hit a 3-pointer to start a 12-0 run by Holy Cross for a 19-14 lead. Meade had two steals to bring his career total to 234, tying the Patriot League record set by Mike Bright of Bucknell from 1994 to 1997.
